claim: Subtracting the number of Marvel Comics superheroes from the number of DC Comics superheroes yields -163.
extra_info: DC refers to publisher_name = 'DC Comics'; Marvel Comics refers to publisher_name = 'Marvel Comics'; difference = SUBTRACT(SUM(publisher_name = 'DC Comics'), SUM(publisher_name = 'Marvel Comics'));
reasoning: The database shows 224 DC Comics superheroes and 387 Marvel Comics superheroes. Subtracting Marvel from DC: 224 - 387 = -163, which exactly matches the claim.

content.text: I'll verify this claim by querying the database. Let me start by exploring the schema and then computing the difference.

input.description: List all tables in the superhero database

attribute       gender          hero_power      race            superpower

content.content:
CREATE TABLE superhero
(
    id             INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    superhero_name TEXT default NULL,
    full_name      TEXT default NULL,
    gender_id      INTEGER          default NULL,
    eye_colour_id  INTEGER          default NULL,
    hair_colour_id INTEGER          default NULL,
    skin_colour_id INTEGER          default NULL,
    race_id        INTEGER          default NULL,
    publisher_id   INTEGER          default NULL,
    alignment_id   INTEGER          default NULL,
    height_cm      INTEGER          default NULL,
    weight_kg      INTEGER          default NULL,
    foreign key (alignment_id) references alignment(id),
    foreign key (eye_colour_id) references colour(id),
    foreign key (gender_id) references gender(id),
    foreign key (hair_colour_id) references colour(id),
    foreign key (publisher_id) references publisher(id),
    foreign key (race_id) references race(id),
    foreign key (skin_colour_id) references colour(id)
);

    weight_kg      INTEGER          default NULL,
    foreign key (alignment_id) references alignment(id),
    foreign key (eye_colour_id) references colour(id),

content.text: Now let me compute the difference: DC Comics count minus Marvel Comics count.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/superhero.sqlite" "SELECT SUM(CASE WHEN p.publisher_name = 'DC Comics' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS dc_count, SUM(CASE WHEN p.publisher_name = 'Marvel Comics' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS marvel_count, SUM(CASE WHEN p.publisher_name = 'DC Comics' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) - SUM(CASE WHEN p.publisher_name = 'Marvel Comics' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS difference FROM superhero s JOIN publisher p ON s.publisher_id = p.id;"
input.description: Compute DC minus Marvel superhero counts

content.text:
The query results show:
- DC Comics superheroes: 224
- Marvel Comics superheroes: 387
- Difference (DC - Marvel): -163

The claim states that subtracting the number of Marvel Comics superheroes from the number of DC Comics superheroes yields -163, which matches exactly: 224 - 387 = -163.
